title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message:
Hi
i have this macbook air where i find a liquid spill on R7611,R7612 & C7615 on P1V05_S0_VREF, i change all this component but the problem is same, fan start 5 sec & shutdown
P1V05_S0_VREF fall 1,043V to 0V when the mac shutdown.
I don't find where P1V05_S0_VREF is generate, do you know?
thanks

title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message:
[QUOTE="raainxx, post: 27774"]i have this macbook air where i find a liquid spill on R7611,R7612 & C7615 on P1V05_S0_VREF, i change all this component but the problem is same, fan start 5 sec & shutdown
[/QUOTE]

P1V05_S0_VREF has at most likely nothing to do with the reason its shutting down. The system is simply going back into a earlier power stage (S5) so the voltage simply does not get generated anymore.

Issues like this can be a pain in the butt.
How does the U6100 area look like (No corrosion)?

I feel like duke might know better on how to solve this

title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message:
ok thanks.
I look near the smc no corrosion, i resolder U6100 nothing better.
PP3V3_SUS=3,34V
I try with a new magsafe board and new cable 820-1722, same issue.
all the board seems clean

title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message: Is Vcore present when the fan spins? Does it shutdown and power on again?

title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message: I check tomorow for the Vcore but no shutdown and stay off, but when i short power pad, he start again.

title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message:
when you say VCORE, is it PPVCC_S0_CPU = 1,74V and fall when fan stop.
The led is orange without battery

title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message: Could be anything. Corrosion under SMC, traces U1900 to Y1905? JTAG?

title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message:
Corrosion near Q8150 is it cause my problem?
thanks

title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message: Possibly, Q8150 is there for the ALL_SYS_PWRGD signal.

title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message: Is the keyboard disconnected when you try?

title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message:
ALL_SYS_PWRGD climb to 3,34 and fall at 0V.
i disconnect keyboard, only magsafe board with cable left board and power adapter.

title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message: There's going to be corrosion somewhere. Time to inspect visually for damage.

title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message:
I inspect all the board under microscope, i put the board in ultrasound cleaner, the board is clean, no corrosion on the board.
i check with scope the signal Y1905 ok i have SYSCLK_CLK25M_X2 at 25mhz but nothing in output of U1900, all PP3V42_G3H=PP3V3_S5=PP3V3_S5RS3RS0_SYSCLKGEN=3,34V during my board is ON.
is it U1900 bad?
thanks

title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message:
U1900 is fine as the only output needed to work is 32kHz on pin 12. Without that the board would not even power on.

Does it stay on for 5 seconds then off and then repeat forever?

title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message:
i have in fact the clock in pin 12 32Khz and always on but the board start and shutdown.
i can't find where is the problem?

title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message: I ask again: Does it stay on for 5 seconds then off and then repeat forever or just stay off?

title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message: no just stay off, if i want to restart the board i need to short the power pad.

title: 820-3437 fan 5 sec and shutdown
message: Either crap under SMC or the termination resistors/traces from U6100 to SMC.
